contentrichtext.text: {{Latin place names}} Users of [[Neo-Latin]] have taken the Latin language to places the [[Rome|Romans]] never went; hence a need arose to make '''Latin names of mountains''' that did not exist when Latin was a living language. ==Strategies for constructing Latin names== :See [[Latin names of cities#Strategies for constructing Latin names|companion article]] ==List of names== <table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3"> <tr><th>Latin</th><th>English name, [other name(s)], [older name(s)], [state/province/region], [nation or state], [continent]</th></tr> <tr><td>Aegaleus¹</td><td>Mount [[Egaleo (mountain)|Aegaleus]], [[Piraeus]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Aenos</td><td>[[Mount Ainos]], [[Kefallinia]]/Cephallonia, [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Aetna¹</td><td>[[Mount Etna]], [[Sicily]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Albus, Mons</td><td>[[Mont Blanc]], [[France]] and [[Italy]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Alpis (ranges)</td><td>[[Alps]], [[France]] to [[Austria]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Alpis Australia?</td><td>[[Australian Alps]], [[New South Wales]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Andes (ranges)</td><td>[[Andes]], [[Chile]] to [[Colombia]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Aroania¹</td><td>Mount [[Aroania]]/[[Chelmos]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Atlas¹ (ranges)</td><td>[[Atlas Mountains]], NW [[Africa]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Carpathi (ranges)</td><td>[[Carpathians]], [[Czechia]] to [[Romania]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Caucasus</td><td>[[Caucasus]] mountains, [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] to [[Azerbaijan]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Cyllene¹</td><td>Mount [[Mount Kyllini|Cyllene]], Kylléne</td></tr> <tr><td>Dalmatia (Alpis)</td><td>[[Dalmatian Mountains]], [[Damlatia]], S [[Croatia]], [[West Balkans]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Dirphys¹</td><td>Mount [[Dirphys]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Elbrus</td><td>Mount [[Elbrus]], [[Caucasus]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Erymanthus¹</td><td>Mount Erymanthus (Olonos)</td></tr> <tr><td>Eryx</td><td>[[Monte San Giuliano]], [[Sicily]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Helicon¹</td><td>[[Mount Helicon]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Herminius Mons</td><td>[[Serra da Estrela]], [[Portugal]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Hymettus¹</td><td>Mount [[Hymettus]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Libani Mons</td><td>[[Mount Lebanon]], [[Lebanon]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Minthe¹</td><td>Mount [[Minthe]], [[Prefecture of Ilia|Ilia]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Oenoe¹</td><td>Mount [[Oenoe]]{{Disambiguation needed|date=June 2011}}, [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympicus (montes)</td><td>[[Olympic Mountains]], [[Washington (state)|Washington]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympus Mons¹ (Asia Minor)</td><td>Mount Olympus, W Turkey</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympus Mons¹ (Cyprus)</td><td>Mount Olympus, Cyprus</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympus Mons¹</td><td>[[Mount Olympus]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympus Mons¹ (N. Zelandia)</td><td>Mount Olympus, New Zealand</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympus Mons¹ (Tenn.)</td><td>Mount Olympus, [[Tennessee]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympus Mons¹ (UT)</td><td>Mount Olympus, [[Utah]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Olympus Mons¹ (Vasingtonia, Olympicus)</td><td>[[Mount Olympus]], [[Washington (state)|Washington]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Ossa¹</td><td>[[Mount Ossa (Greece)|Mount Ossa]], [[Thessaly]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Ossa (Tasmania)</td><td>[[Mount Ossa (Tasmania)|Mount Ossa]], Tasmania, Australia</td></tr> <tr><td>Parnassus¹</td><td>Mount [[Parnassus]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Pentele¹</td><td>[[Pentele]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Pholoe¹</td><td>Mount [[Pholoe]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Pindus¹</td><td>Pindus, Pindos</td></tr> <tr><td>Parnetha¹</td><td>Mount [[Parnetha]], [[Parnitha]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Regius (Mons)</td><td>[[Mount Royal]], [[Quebec]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Rhodopes¹</td><td>[[Rhodopes]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Scollis¹</td><td>Mount [[Scollis]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Sudeti (ranges)</td><td>[[Sudetes]], [[Poland]] to [[Czechia]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Taurus¹ (ranges)</td><td>[[Taurus Mountains]], S [[Turkey]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Taygetus¹</td><td>Mount [[Taygetus]], [[Taygetos]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Transylvania</td><td>[[Transylvania]], N [[Romania]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Vergina</td><td>Mount [[Vergina]], [[Greece]]</td></tr> <tr><td>Vesuvius</td><td>Mount [[Vesuvius]], [[Italy]]</td></tr> </table> # Latinized form of a Greek-derived mountain name ==External links== *[http://www.bayerische-landesbibliothek-online.de/orbis-latinus Graesse, Orbis Latinus] *[http://www.uni-mannheim.de/mateo/camenaref/hofmann.html Hofmann: Lexicon Universale] [[Category:Latin names of places|Mountains]] [[Category:Lists of mountains]]
